skill.name: pubmed-database
skill.description: Direct REST API access to PubMed. Advanced Boolean/MeSH queries, E-utilities API, batch processing, citation management. For Python workflows, prefer biopython (Bio.Entrez). Use this for direct HTTP/REST work or custom API implementations.
skill.summary: Direct REST API access to PubMed. Advanced Boolean/MeSH queries, E-utilities API, batch processing, ...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No executable code or automation is present. Content is documentation for PubMed search syntax and API usage. No data access, exfiltration, or persistence patterns found.

content.user_title: Build precise PubMed searches and API calls
content.value_statement: Researchers struggle to build accurate PubMed queries and API requests. This skill provides clear syntax, filters, and E-utilities guidance for reliable searches.
actual_capabilities: Explain Boolean operators, field tags, and proximity syntax for PubMed queries
Provide MeSH term and subheading usage patterns
Outline ESearch, EFetch, ESummary, ELink, and EPost workflows
Document rate limits and history server usage
Show citation matching format for ECitMatch
limitations: Does not access PubMed directly or execute API calls
Cannot provide full text when PubMed only has citations or abstracts
Limited by PubMed rate limits and result caps
Search history and clipboard limits are controlled by PubMed

use_cases.title: Design a literature search
use_cases.description: Create a MeSH driven query with filters for a thesis review.

use_cases.title: Plan API extraction
use_cases.description: Map ESearch and EFetch steps with batching and rate limits.

use_cases.title: Find high quality evidence
use_cases.description: Build focused queries for RCTs and systematic reviews.

prompt_templates.title: Start a topic search
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a PubMed query for recent studies on type 2 diabetes and diet. Include date range and English filter.

prompt_templates.title: MeSH focused query
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a PubMed query using MeSH terms and subheadings for hypertension drug therapy with RCTs only.

prompt_templates.title: API search plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline an E-utilities workflow to search PubMed and fetch abstracts in batches of 200 with history server.

prompt_templates.title: Citation match
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide ECitMatch input lines for two citations using journal, year, volume, page, and author.

output_examples.input: Create a query for 2021 to 2024 systematic reviews on asthma treatment with free full text.
output: Suggested query: asthma[tiab] AND treatment[tiab] AND systematic review[pt] AND 2021:2024[dp] AND free full text[sb]
Tip: add MeSH term asthma[mh] to broaden coverage
Use Advanced Search to verify query translation

best_practices: Use MeSH terms with synonyms joined by OR
Apply publication type and date filters to narrow results
Use history server for large result sets
anti_patterns: Using NOT to exclude broad terms without review
Ignoring rate limits and User-Agent requirements
Assuming PubMed provides full text for all records

faq.question: Is this compatible with PubMed E-utilities?
faq.answer: Yes. It documents query syntax and E-utilities endpoints used by PubMed.

faq.question: What limits should I expect?
faq.answer: PubMed enforces rate limits and a 10,000 result display cap.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with scripts?
faq.answer: Yes. It outlines REST endpoints and parameters for scripted requests.

faq.question: Does it collect or store my notice data?
faq.answer: No. The skill is documentation only and does not access your data.

faq.question: Why do I get zero results?
faq.answer: Check spelling, reduce filters, and review query translation in Advanced Search.

faq.question: How is this different from biopython?
faq.answer: Biopython is a Python client. This focuses on direct HTTP and syntax guidance.
